title: Mike Firestone's emails regarding mass and cass 2

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Massachusetts Public Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

I hereby request all emails sent or received by Mike Firestone (both @boston.gov and any external on- or off‑government accounts) from September 1, 2023, through the date of fulfillment that contain any of the following keywords:

"Mass and Cass", "Methadone Mile", "Recovery Road", "overdose", "opioid", "fentanyl", "heroin", "narcan", "shelter", "homeless", "encampment", "tent city", "drug use", "public drug use", "open drug scene", "syringe", "Engagement Center", "Project TRUST", "harm reduction", "transitional housing", "low-barrier housing", "daycenter", "public safety", "violence", "crime", "stabbing", "trafficking", "mental health", "addiction", "substance use disorder", "EMS", "emergency calls", "overdoses reversed", "Long Island", "bridge", "recovery campus", "street outreach", "engagement", "sobriety requirements" "ahope" "BPHC" "Boston Public Health Commission"  any variations of "Dr Ojutiku" ( ie "Dr.O" "Dr O" "BISOLA"  "BISOLA Ojutiku" Capital lower case),  "727"  "congregate outdoor drug use" "congregate outdoor substance use" "drug" "drugs" "substance"  "Substance use" "woods mullen" "WMS"	"SHS" " "southampton shelter" "shelter" "atkinson" "encampment" "ACLU"

Please include complete metadata (to/from/date/subject) We request these records be provided in an accessible digital format. 

Please confirm which keywords have no responsive documents and what systems have been searched.

I also request that, if appropriate, fees be waived as we believe this request is in the public interest, as suggested but not stipulated by the recommendations of the Massachusetts Supervisor of Public Records. The requested documents will be made available to the general public free of charge as part of the public information service at MuckRock.com, and is not made for commercial usage.

I expect the request to be filled in an accessible format, including for screen readers, which provide text-to-speech for persons unable to read print. Files that are not accessible to screen readers include, for example, .pdf image files as well as physical documents.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Brian McCarter
